regulationsummary: The regulation sets out the licensing framework for money service providers, requiring applicants to demonstrate that they and any ultimate owners are fit and proper persons  Licences are issued for a fixed period, must be renewed in advance, and can be amended, revoked or suspended only after giving the licensee a reasonable opportunity to be heard and by written notice that includes reasons and the right to appeal  Licensees must keep their particulars up to date, notify the Registrar of any changes within one month, and display the licence at their premises  The regulator may impose conditions on licences and requires that any changes to premises or business activities be approved in writing  Fitandproper checks cover criminal convictions, financial standing, and compliance history, and when the ultimate owner is foreign or otherwise highrisk, enhanced due diligence EDD is mandatory

actionablerules.obligation: Before granting a licence, the regulator must confirm that the applicant and any ultimate owner are fit and proper persons, based on criminal, financial, and compliance criteria
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All individuals, partnerships, and corporations applying for a money service licence
risksignalstomonitor: Criminal convictions related to money laundering, fraud, or corruption
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Criminal record checks for applicant and ultimate owners
Financial statements and proof of solvency
Evidence of compliance with previous licences or regulations
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  if the ultimate owner is foreign, politically exposed, or otherwise highrisk, the regulator must conduct enhanced due diligence

actionablerules.obligation: Licensees must apply for licence renewal at least 45 days before expiry and submit the required form, fee, and updated information
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All licence holders of money services
risksignalstomonitor: Missing or outdated information in renewal application
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Updated fitandproper documentation if any changes
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  standard renewal checks apply unless there are changes to ultimate owners or business activities

actionablerules.obligation: Licensees must notify the regulator in writing of any change to their particulars eg, address, ownership, business activities within one month of the change
risksignalstomonitor: Unreported changes to premises or ownership
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  routine update however, if the change involves a new ultimate owner, fitandproper checks must be repeated

actionablerules.obligation: If the regulator decides to revoke or suspend a licence, it must first give the licensee a reasonable opportunity to be heard and then issue a written notice that includes reasons, the duration of suspension if applicable, and the right to appeal
risksignalstomonitor: Failure to respond to regulatory inquiries
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Record of hearing or opportunity to be heard
Documentation of any remedial actions required
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  this is a disciplinary procedure, not a duediligence assessment

actionablerules.obligation: When a licensee adds new premises or changes business activities, it must obtain written approval from the regulator and ensure the premises are suitable and occupants have provided consent
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All licence holders seeking to expand or change premises
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Proof of suitability eg, site plan, security assessment
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  the approval process is procedural however, if the new premises are in a highrisk jurisdiction, additional EDD may be warranted
